abstract: New documentary Censored Voices, about 1967 Middle East war, features archival footage interspersed with previously unseen interviews with Israeli soldiers who give accounts of brutal behavior toward their Arab adversaries; film debuts as International Criminal Court weighs investigation in latest Gaza conflict.
lead_paragraph: As the International Criminal Court considers a war crimes investigation in the recent Gaza conflict, a new documentary film is showcasing previously unaired accounts of the brutal experiences of an earlier generation of Israeli soldiers.
snippet: As the International Criminal Court considers a war crimes investigation in the recent Gaza conflict, a new documentary film is showcasing previously unaired accounts of the brutal experiences of an earlier generation of Israeli soldiers.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Disillusioned by War, Israeli Soldiers Muted in 1967 Are Given Fuller Voice
headline.print_headline: Disillusioned by War, Israeli Soldiers Muted in 1967 Are Given Fuller Voice
